[File: src/net.rs] [NonceRequest vs SignatureShareRequest] [Type Match - Critical] Must SignatureShareRequest.signature_type match the original NonceRequest.signature_type?
[File: src/net.rs] [SignatureShareRequest vs NonceResponse] [All IDs Match - Critical] Do all NonceResponses in SignatureShareRequest have identical dkg_id, sign_id, sign_iter_id, and message?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgPrivateBegin] [Malicious Exclusion - High] Can coordinator exclude honest signers from DKG by not including them in signer_ids?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgEndBegin] [Premature Finalization - High] Can coordinator force premature DKG completion by sending DkgEndBegin before all shares distributed?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: NonceRequest] [Nonce Grinding - Critical] Can coordinator request multiple NonceRequests for same message with different sign_iter_id to grind for favorable nonces?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: SignatureShareRequest] [Cherry-Picking - Critical] Can coordinator selectively include/exclude nonce_responses to manipulate which signers participate in threshold?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: SignatureShareRequest] [Response Reordering - High] Can coordinator reorder nonce_responses to change binding value computation?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgPublicShares] [Invalid Commitments - Critical] Can malicious signer send invalid polynomial commitments that pass validation but result in wrong group key?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgPrivateShares] [Wrong Shares - Critical] Can malicious signer send incorrectly encrypted shares that decrypt to wrong values, poisoning DKG?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgEnd] [False Success - High] Can malicious signer report DkgStatus::Success even after receiving bad shares, hiding attacks?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: NonceResponse] [Nonce Reuse - Critical] Can malicious signer reuse nonces across different messages by sending same NonceResponse to multiple NonceRequests?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: SignatureShareResponse] [Invalid Shares - Critical] Can malicious signer send invalid signature shares that appear valid but break final signature aggregation?
[File: src/net.rs] [All Messages] [Message Ordering - High] Can messages arrive out of order causing state machine confusion (e.g., DkgPrivateShares before DkgPublicShares)?
[File: src/net.rs] [All Messages] [Duplicate Messages - Medium] Can receiving duplicate messages (same dkg_id/sign_id) cause double-processing or state confusion?
[File: src/net.rs] [All Messages] [Delayed Messages - Medium] Can delayed messages from old rounds be replayed causing state machine regression?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: Packet] [Packet Size - Medium] Is there a maximum packet size limit to prevent DoS via giant packets?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: Packet] [Signature Length - Medium] Is sig vector bounded in length, or can arbitrarily long signatures cause DoS?
[File: src/net.rs] [All Messages] [Serialization Size - Medium] Are serialized message sizes bounded to prevent network DoS?
[File: src/net.rs] [Function: NonceRequest::hash()] [Message Binding - Critical] Is the message bytes securely bound to all round IDs (dkg_id, sign_id, sign_iter_id) in the hash?
[File: src/net.rs] [Function: SignatureShareRequest::hash()] [Nonce Binding - Critical] Are all nonce_responses cryptographically bound to prevent substitution attacks?
[File: src/net.rs] [Function: DkgPublicShares::hash()] [Commitment Binding - Critical] Are polynomial commitments securely bound to prevent swapping between signers?
[File: src/net.rs] [All DKG Messages] [DKG ID Monotonicity - High] Must dkg_id be strictly increasing to prevent replay of old DKG rounds?
[File: src/net.rs] [All Signing Messages] [Sign ID Uniqueness - High] Must sign_id be unique per DKG round, or can it be reused after DKG rotation?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: NonceRequest] [Iter ID Purpose - Medium] What is the security purpose of sign_iter_id - does it prevent some specific attack?
[File: src/net.rs] [Struct: DkgPublicShares] [Comms Invariant - High] Must comms vector have exactly one entry per party, or can parties contribute multiple commitments?
